intro: Sherbournia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. Sherbournia species typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, yellow or orange flowers in clusters. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The genus includes several species, such as Sherbournia africana and Sherbournia tenuifolia, which are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
